intro: Byttneria rubicaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed bignay, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-colored stems and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ornamental contexts.
